briefTitle: The Analgesic Efficacy of Protocol for Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA)
officialTitle: The Analgesic Efficacy of Adding the IPACK Block to a Multimodal Analgesia Protocol for Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty

interventions.name: ultrasound guided injection of local anesthetic between the popliteal artery and the capsule of the knee (iPACK)

summary: This is a perspective, randomized, blinded study with a parallel design and an allocation ratio of 1 to 1 for the treatment groups to assess the analgesic efficacy of adding the iPACK (injection between the popliteal artery and the capsule of the knee) in addition to the adductor canal block (ACB) for Total Knee Arthoplasty patients (TKA).

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Presenting With Pain in the Back of the Knee 6 Hours After Surgery
